title: Rogue cops to clean Pasig River, says Duterte
text: Headlines   Rogue cops to clean Pasig River, says Duterte By Alexis Romero   8:00pm President Rodrigo Duterte delivers a message during his visit at the Police Regional Office-12 Headquarters in General Santos City on Sept. 23, 2016. Karl Norman Alonzo/PPD MANILA, Philippines — Erring cops would not undergo retraining but would just clean the Pasig River, President Rodrigo Duterte said Monday as he cursed law enforcers who are involved in illegal activities. Duterte rejected the proposal of Philippine National Police (PNP) Director General Ronald “Bato” dela Rosa to subject rogue policemen to a disciplinary training and prefers that they report to his office. “Bato wants the policemen retrained but I countermanded his offer. I want them to report in Malacañan, you sons of b . You report to the place where I sleep, you line up,” the president said during the launch of the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) tax campaign in Pasay City. “Do not enter my house. Stay outside. I want them to clean the Pasig River. After all, they are being paid,” he added. Duterte vowed to badmouth rogue policemen who are involved in corruption, extortion and other criminal activities. On Saturday, Duterte said erring policemen should not undergo retraining but should be suspended from the service.
